edu.umn.cs.dccn.proj1.com
Class CentralServer

java.lang.Object
  edu.umn.cs.dccn.proj1.com.CentralServer

public class CentralServer
extends Object

Creates a centralised server.

This server will be used by the various peers to find neighbours.

A list of peers and their address will be held in memory (by default) or in an external file as specified by the user.

Author:
Vivek Ranjan

Field Detail

dictionaryInFile

private static boolean dictionaryInFile
TRUE if the user wants a list of peers stored in a file. Set by -f

dictionaryFileLocation

private static String dictionaryFileLocation
Location of the file that stores the list of peers

Logger used to print messages and errors on the standard output (usually the console - configuration in config/logback.xml).

logLevel

private static String logLevel
Logger level. To decide which logging statements to be printed by the program. By default set to INFO in production environment. During development, set to TRACE

peerAddresses

private static List<String> peerAddresses
List of all the peers on the network

port

private static int port
Port used by the server to listen for messages from peers. Set as 5555 by default

Socket that listens for commands.

Constructor Detail

CentralServer

public CentralServer()
Method Detail

main

public static void main(String[] args)
Entry point for the program. Starts the central server and listens for messages and responds as required.

Parameters:
args - Optional command line arguments

removePeer

private static void removePeer(String originalAddress)
Removes the peer from the list of peers maintained in the memory and, if enabled, in the file.

Parameters:
originalAddress - The original address of the Peer that needs to be removed. This needs to be the same as the address of the peer that was used to register with the central server.

quit

private static void quit()
Gracefully shuts down the program.

parseArgs

private static void parseArgs(String[] args)
Helper method to parse the optional input arguments and set the fields accordingly.

The following command line arguments can be used:

  • -f : Stores the list of peers in the specified file
  • -p : Server will listen for messages on the specified server. Default port is 5555

Parameters:
args - Optional command line arguments used while running the program.
